result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Plea Diversion Agreement - 6 months

9:29 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Brian Mares.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.   ADA Vanden Branden recites agreement - defendant will plea to count 1 and all other counts will be dismissed and read in.  Defendant will enter into a 6 month PDA.  Atty Mares concurs with one change to PDA - defendant pleads no contest (PDA reads guilty plea). Defendant also had PDA on 15CM52 which has been completed. 

Court questions defendant.  Defendant enters a plea of No Contest to count 1.  Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court approves the PDA and withholds judgment of conviction pending compliance with PDA.  Counts 2, 3, and 4 will be dismissed and read in.

Court adjourned 9:39 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 11, 2017 at 09:00 am.
Letter from Atty Brian Mares dated March 13, 2017 re Subpoenas
Final pre-trial on February 17, 2017 at 08:30 am.
State's
Final pre-trial on February 15, 2017 at 09:00 am.
Final pre-trial on February 8, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on April 11, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial on February 15, 2017 at 08:30 am.
State's
Telephone scheduling conference on October 20, 2016 at 08:45 am.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: of Judge
for Return/Destruction of Exhibits
State's Exhibit #1

10:05 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Brian Mares.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Mares - preliminary hearing to proceed.  Atty Mares requests sequestration.  Court orders sequestration. 

Chad R. Krause sworn, direct by ADA Vanden Branden is employed as an officer for Berlin Police Department for 18 years and an officer for approx 20 years.  Goes over the date in question. ADA offers exhibit #1.  No objection by Atty Mares.  Court receives exhibit #1.  Cross exam by Atty Mares.  ADA requests officer be excused.  No objection by Atty Mares.  Court excuses the witness.

Jessica Schroeder sworn, direct by ADA Vanden Branden is employed as an officer for Berlin Police Department for 3 years and an officer since 1999.  Goes over the date in question.  Cross exam by Atty Mares.  Court excuses the witness.

Timothy D. Jones sworn, direct by ADA Vanden Branden is employed as an Sargent of Investigations for Berlin Police Deparment for 26 1/2 years.  Goes over the date in question.  Cross exam by Atty Mares.  Court excuses the witness.

Douglas A. Christensen sworn, direct by ADA Vanden Branden is employed as a school liason officer for BPD approx 26 years and a law enforcement officer for 27 years.  Goes over the date in question.  Venue established.  Identified the defendant present in court.  Court excuses the witness.

Argument by ADA Vanden Branden.  Objection by Atty Mares without argument.

Court determines that probable cause exists and a felony may have been committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  State files an information with the court.  Attorney Mares and defendant acknowledge receipt of the information and waives any reading.  Atty Mares enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant.  

Statement by Atty Mares regarding substitution of judge.  Court grants the defendant 10 days to file a request for substitution of judge.  Court will set for internal review for 10 days.

Court adjourned at 10:33 a.m.
Preliminary hearing on September 6, 2016 at 10:00 am.
for Continuance
Preliminary hearing on July 5, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on June 21, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

2:25 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Brian Mares.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Mares - we have not had a preliminary hearing in this matter.  Court will set for prelim after june 1st.  Court sets for Preliminary hearing on June 21, 2016 at 3:30 p.m. 

Court adjourned at 2:27 p.m.
Summary of Restitution & Costs w/attachments - $48.00
**PROCESSING COMPLETE**
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.
Status hearing on May 17, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

8:34 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Brian Mares.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Mares confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the time limits.  Court will set for Status Hearing on May 17, 2016 at 2:00 p.m.

Court adjourned at 8:36 a.m.
and Appearance - By Atty Brian Mares
